alert.note: Alert for Atascosa; Frio; Medina (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 20 at 5:05AM CDT until May 20 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Atascosa County in south central Texas... Northern Frio County in south central Texas... Southeastern Medina County in south central Texas... * Until 700 AM CDT. * At 505 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms previously produced heavy rain across the warned area. Light to occasional moderate rain continues to fall within the warned area. Between 2 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flooding was reported in Lytle at several locations. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pleasanton, Devine, Poteet, Lytle, Natalia, Moore, Bigfoot, Yancey, Frio Town, Leming, Three Oaks, Kyote, Iuka, Rossville, Amphion and Espey. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
